snippet.textDisplay: Currently when we compare the. Audio of the Mega Drive (Genesis) with the audio of Super Nintendo, although in Super Nintendo we can observe better clarity of instruments of oorquestras, the impression that I have is that there was at the maximum 4 channels of simultaneous audio, already in the 16 bit of Sega exist games that have so many simultaneous sound channels and instrumental speed that take us to another dimension of gameplay.

snippet.textDisplay: One day in a bar I was speaking with a friend's colleague and we talk about rpg . We talk about the firs rpg (no action rpg) who played. My answer was Suikoden I for PS1, the man older than me answered: Shining Force 1. Suddenly silence and a great respect for that man.

snippet.textDisplay: @DragonNexus Maybe I am reading into this idea a bit too much, but I've found that concept to be in quite a few  Japanese-made RPGs that were made then. But now, the RPGs of today are just flurishing with great stories and personalities. Good examples that aren't Final Fantasy games would  be Skies of Arcadia and Lost Odyssey.
snippet.textOriginal: @DragonNexus Maybe I am reading into this idea a bit too much, but I've found that concept to be in quite a few  Japanese-made RPGs that were made then. But now, the RPGs of today are just flurishing with great stories and personalities. Good examples that aren't Final Fantasy games would  be Skies of Arcadia and Lost Odyssey.

snippet.textDisplay: @DragonNexus Yeah, fundamentally.. You would never find a novel revolving around SF. The characters were really one-dimensional when it came to their own personal development story-wise.. But each one had thier own unique personality.. So with that being said, in in a sense, I imagine they made the characters as ambiguous as possible, including the main hero (who is usually always mute).. So that the player could relate whatever feelings and thoughts they had about the characters as a whole.
snippet.textOriginal: @DragonNexus Yeah, fundamentally.. You would never find a novel revolving around SF. The characters were really one-dimensional when it came to their own personal development story-wise.. But each one had thier own unique personality.. So with that being said, in in a sense, I imagine they made the characters as ambiguous as possible, including the main hero (who is usually always mute).. So that the player could relate whatever feelings and thoughts they had about the characters as a whole.

snippet.textDisplay: I remember being 5 or 6 and playing this game on the Genesis at my aunt's house. snippet.textDisplay: @clustro Pantasy Star 4 is amazing as well, equally amazing music.  Check out LandStalker as well for great game play and music (same composer for that game too), although I'm sure you already have.  SF is still my favorite game ever.

snippet.textDisplay:
That said, I absolutely love this song... so many memories of playing this game, so so many times. It's got such a great story, and the twists and turns are awesome. This song always reminds me specifically of every cool thing that ever happened in any town. The beginning when Bowie wakes up at home, going to school, buying weapons, finding Oddler, being shrunk down and finding the chess board world, the way that the towns people moved to the music...

God this was a great fucking game.
snippet.textOriginal:
That said, I absolutely love this song... so many memories of playing this game, so so many times. It's got such a great story, and the twists and turns are awesome. This song always reminds me specifically of every cool thing that ever happened in any town. The beginning when Bowie wakes up at home, going to school, buying weapons, finding Oddler, being shrunk down and finding the chess board world, the way that the towns people moved to the music...

God this was a great fucking game.

snippet.textOriginal: this game is on the upcoming Sonic's Ultimate game collection :D

snippet.textDisplay:
Oh man I remember this game, I'm not a big fan of strategy based games but I loved Shining Force 2, great story, amazing characters, great music.

I played this game for 3 days straight when I got it, from the moment I woke up to the moment I went to bed, minus bathroom breaks and food obviously.
snippet.textOriginal:
Oh man I remember this game, I'm not a big fan of strategy based games but I loved Shining Force 2, great story, amazing characters, great music.

I played this game for 3 days straight when I got it, from the moment I woke up to the moment I went to bed, minus bathroom breaks and food obviously.

snippet.textDisplay: amazing song from arguably the best megadrive game released, top choice!

snippet.textDisplay: Classic! Love the choice

snippet.textDisplay: Used to leave this on my TV.  Song rocks.
snippet.textOriginal: Used to leave this on my TV.  Song rocks.

snippet.textDisplay: It's still lively even after all these years.
snippet.textOriginal: It's still lively even after all these years.

snippet.textDisplay:
I just wish you could take a look at Shining Force III. That OST is just epic. 

P.S: Love your awesome work. ;)
snippet.textOriginal:
I just wish you could take a look at Shining Force III. That OST is just epic.

snippet.textDisplay: Kinda sounds like the Dragon Quest IV town theme.
snippet.textOriginal: Kinda sounds like the Dragon Quest IV town theme.

snippet.textDisplay: Geez. After listening to this song for about 30 seconds, I realized this song has an amazing amount of depth and variety for it's time. Hell, it beats out a lot of recent title's OST's by a long shot. A very nice selection, SupraDarky. Please keep it up!
snippet.textOriginal: Geez. After listening to this song for about 30 seconds, I realized this song has an amazing amount of depth and variety for it's time. Hell, it beats out a lot of recent title's OST's by a long shot. A very nice selection, SupraDarky. Please keep it up!

snippet.textDisplay: Oh, mah gawd! Shining Force 2! Man, the whole game was full of catchy tunes. I think my favourite was the dwarf song, although the actual name of it escapes me right now...
snippet.textOriginal: Oh, mah gawd! Shining Force 2! Man, the whole game was full of catchy tunes. I think my favourite was the dwarf song, although the actual name of it escapes me right now...
